William T. (Bill) Brooks is this
week making announcement of
his candidacy for the office of
State Corporation Commissioner,
subject to the will of the voters in
the Democratic primary election
September 8, 1864.


In announcing his candidacy,
Brooks declared his pledge of
compliance with the, expressed
need, on the part of Arizona resi-
dents in all walks of life, for
fortnight administration of the
affairs of that vitality important
state department.


He stresses his qualifications,
both from the standpoint of ex-

Mrs. c. NJ Neal president Arizona State Baptist
on senior womens division speaker the annual
Womans Day held Sum- May 81 Mt Olive Baptist Church
in Chandler Rev. P. R. McDanes of the church.


Her topic was Leaders for These Troubled Tines


Mrs. Neal also addressed the Bible Missionary Baptist Church.
in the afternoon. Her Trnng and Christian Education
in the Home.'


The annual Chdrens Day program will be held Sum-, June


St. Marks Unity Temple. 18th and W. Tono Bishop A.
Johnson Topic the day will be Tran Child AS You
Would Have Him Co..


Rev. and Mrs. c. NJ Neal motoring points the
and for long vacation They plan The Worlds Fair
in New York.

A few charcoal briquets will
help remove stubborn food odors
from your refrigerator. Put
three or four pieces in a dispos-
able small pie-tin in your refrig-
orator and it will remain odor-
free.


The more frequent showers
and baths you will be taking dur
ing the hot summer will be more
pleasant if your water is soft.
Lindsay company experts say
soft water is more refreshing
because it washes away all the
soap and dirt instead of leaving
a thin film of scum on the skin
as hard water does. You'll use
less soap with soft water, too.


Before you wash any throw
rug, haste a piece of fabric such
as an old torn sheet to one edge.
1t makes it easier to pin on the
clothesline.


Line your vegetable crisper
with paper toweling to prevent
vegetable spoilage. The towels
absorb any moisture which ac-
cumulates at the bottom.

perience and dependability, and
urges thorough appraisal of such
requirements by all voters in the
coming Democratic primary, and
also the ensuing general election
in November.


He has been a resident of
Chandler continuously for the
past A years, is married and the
father of two sons. In the past he
has served both as State Treas
urer and Corporation Commits
Sioner.


AS member of Mathew B.
Juan Post, American Legion, he
has been elected Commander
three times, and also served one
term as Commander of Legion
District No. 8.

Making several members Of the Leagues Julian Yanks
happv are the Debonairs Social and Art Club.


The club recently $l35 for baseball uniforms and
equipment to the team.


Shown front row Webb, Melvin Mnnifed, Marvin
Brooks and Herbert Johnson.


members shown visiting the team are Mes
danes Rufin and Lille Belcher.


Standing Charles James Michael Graves
Dwight Warren, Ray Brandon, Dan Young Bill Sims travis VIII
liams and


Chdres Of the Julian Yanks Coaches are
Ted and Rudy Jackson.
